comment.author: 27000124@N05
comment._content:
Above photo is an M-3A1 'Stuart' Light Tank (I earlier identified this as just an M-3 but have since learned that the original M3 had sponson machine guns mounted on both sides of the driver(s) which were removed on the M3A1). Photo below shows an M3 "Stuart" Light Tank from the 13th Cavalry, 7th Cavalry Group (Mechanized) at Fort Knox  with sponson machine guns mounted.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/us_army_rolling_along/4208890340/]
